content.statement: vascular:anatomy:anat-006-accessory-renals is a fundamental concept in Health-Sciences Medicine Surgery Vascular Anatomy that provides essential knowledge for understanding related topics and clinical/practical applications.

explanation.intuition: Understanding vascular:anatomy:anat-006-accessory-renals helps build foundational knowledge. The concept connects to broader principles in the field.
explanation.key_insight: The key aspects of vascular:anatomy:anat-006-accessory-renals include core principles, common applications, and integration with related concepts.
explanation.technical_details: Technical details involve specific mechanisms, measurements, and evidence-based applications of vascular:anatomy:anat-006-accessory-renals.

location.upper_pole: Usually arises from aorta superior to main renal artery
location.lower_pole: Arises from aorta, iliac, or main renal; may cross ureter

aortic_surgery.management: Reimplant if >3-4mm, supplies >1/3 parenchyma, or solitary kidney
aortic_surgery.sacrifice_criteria: Small caliber (<2mm), poor kidney function, well-collateralized

renal_transplant.complexity: Multiple arteries require multiple anastomoses or bench reconstruction
renal_transplant.technique: May anastomose on back table before implant

UPJ_obstruction.mechanism: Lower pole artery crossing anterior to ureter

EVAR.concern: Coverage of accessory artery during deployment

imaging.CTA: Gold standard - multiplanar reconstructions show all arteries
imaging.MRA: Alternative, especially for renal function concerns

definition.@value: Additional renal arteries arising from the aorta or its branches, present in 25-30% of individuals, typically supplying the upper or lower kidney pole as end arteries without significant collateralization.

citations.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Recognize the prevalence and patterns of accessory renal arteries
Understand the clinical implications during aortic surgery
Apply decision-making for reimplantation vs sacrifice
Identify the association with UPJ obstruction
clinical_pearls: 25-30% of people have accessory renal arteries - EXPECT them
Accessory renals are END ARTERIES - ligation = segmental infarction
Lower pole artery crossing ureter can cause UPJ obstruction
Reimplant if >3-4mm, supplies >1/3 kidney, or solitary kidney
CTA is MANDATORY before aortic surgery to identify all renal arteries

medicalCode.description: Other congenital malformations of renal artery
